flavor: A highly appealing move.
effect: Gives a high number of appeal points wth no other effects.

flavor: Affected by how well the appeal in front goes.
effect: If the Pokemon that appealed before the user earned less than three appeal points, user earns six; if three, user earns three; if more than three, user earns none.

flavor: After this move, the user is more easily startled.
effect: If the user is jammed this turn after using this move, it will receive twice as many jam points.

flavor: Badly startles the Pokemon in front.
effect: Attempts to jam the Pokemon that appealed before the user.

flavor: Badly startles those that have made appeals.
effect: Attempts to jam all Pokemon that have appealed this turn.

flavor: Jams the others, and misses one turn of appeals.
effect: Attempts to jam the other Pokemon.  The user cannot make an appeal on the next turn, but it cannot be jammed either.

flavor: Makes a great appeal, but allows no more to the end.
effect: User cannot make any more appeals for the remainder of the contest.

flavor: Startles all Pokemon that have done their appeals.
effect: Attempts to jam all Pokemon that have appealed this turn.

flavor: Startles the Pokemon that appealed before the user.
effect: Attempts to jam the Pokemon that appealed before the user.

flavor: Startles the Pokemon that has the judge's attention.
effect: Attempts to jam all Pokemon that have appealed this turn.  If a Pokemon is in combo standby status, it is jammed 5 points instead of 1.

flavor: The appeal works best the more the crowd is excited.
effect: If the Applause meter is empty or at one, earns one point; if two, earns three points; if three, earns four points; if four, earns six points.

flavor: Works well if it's the same type as the one before.
effect: If the last Pokemon's appeal is the same type as this move, user earns six points instead of two.

flavor: An appeal that excites the audience in any contest.
effect: Always adds a point to the applause meter, regardless of whether the move matches the contest, and can likewise gain the applause bonus.

flavor: Badly startles all Pokemon that made good appeals.
effect: Attempts to jam all Pokemon that have appealed this turn for half their appeal points (minimum 1).

flavor: Can avoid being startled by others.
effect: Prevents jamming for the rest of this turn.

flavor: Can avoid being startled by others once.
effect: Prevents the next jam on this turn.

flavor: Can be repeatedly used without boring the judge.
effect: Repeated use does not incur a penalty.

flavor: Makes all Pokemon after the user nervous.
effect: Attempts to make all following Pokemon nervous (and thus unable to appeal).

flavor: Makes the appeal as good as the one before it.
effect: User earns appeal points equal to the points the previous Pokemon earned plus one.

flavor: Makes the appeal as good as those before it.
effect: User earns appeal points equal to half the points ALL the previous Pokemon earned plus one.

flavor: Scrambles up the order of appeals on the next turn.
effect: Shuffles the next turn's turn order.

flavor: Shifts the judge's attention from others.
effect: Cancels combo standby status for all Pokemon that have appealed this turn.

flavor: Startles Pokemon that made a same-type appeal.
effect: Attempts to jam all Pokemon that have appealed this turn.  If a Pokemon used the same type move as this one, it is jammed for 4 points instead of 1.

flavor: Temporarily stops the crowd from getting excited.
effect: Prevents the Applause Meter from rising for the rest of the turn.

flavor: The appeal's quality depends on its timing.
effect: Randomly earns one, two, four, or eight points.

flavor: The appeal works better the later it is performed.
effect: If user appeals first this turn, earns one point; if second, two points; if third, four points; if last, six points.

flavor: The appeal works great if performed first.
effect: If user appeals first this turn, earns six points instead of two.

flavor: The appeal works great if performed last.
effect: If user appeals last this turn, earns six points instead of two.

flavor: The appeal works well if the user's condition is good.
effect: If user has no stars, earns one point; if one, three points; if two, five points; if three, seven points.  This does not include the appeal point bonus the stars give.

flavor: The next appeal can be made earlier next turn.
effect: User will go first next turn.

flavor: The next appeal can be made later next turn.
effect: User will go last next turn.

flavor: Ups the user's condition.  Helps prevent nervousness.
effect: User gains one star.

flavor: Worsens the condition of those that made appeals.
effect: Removes all stars from all Pokemon that have appealed this turn.
